entry.name: dialog
entry.title: Dialog Widget
entry.desc: Open content in an interactive overlay.

longdesc.p: A dialog is a floating window that contains a title bar and a content area. The dialog window can be moved, resized and closed with the 'x' icon by default.
If the content length exceeds the maximum height, a scrollbar will automatically appear.
A bottom button bar and semi-transparent modal overlay layer are common options that can be added.

ul.li: Draggable (optional; for use with the draggable option)
Resizable (optional; for use with the resizable option)
Effects Core (optional; for use with the show and hide options)

option.name: autoOpen
option.desc: If set to true, the dialog will automatically open upon initialization. If false, the dialog will stay hidden until the open() method is called.

option.name: buttons
option.desc: Specifies which buttons should be displayed on the dialog. The context of the callback is the dialog element; if you need access to the button, it is available as the target of the event object.

type.name: Object
type.desc: The keys are the button labels and the values are the callbacks for when the associated button is clicked.

type.name: Array
type.desc: Each element of the array must be an object defining the attributes, properties, and event handlers to set on the button.

option.name: closeOnEscape
option.desc: Specifies whether the dialog should close when it has focus and the user presses the esacpe (ESC) key.

option.name: closeText
option.desc: Specifies the text for the close button. Note that the close text is visibly hidden when using a standard theme.

option.name: dialogClass
option.desc: The specified class name(s) will be added to the dialog, for additional theming.

option.name: draggable
option.desc: If set to true, the dialog will be draggable by the title bar. Requires the jQuery UI Draggable wiget to be included.

option.name: height
option.desc: The height of the dialog.

type.name: String
type.desc: The only supported string value is "auto" which will allow the dialog height to adjust based on its content.

option.name: hide
option.desc: If and how to animate the hiding of the dialog.

type.name: Number
type.desc: The dialog will fade out while animating the height and width for the specified duration.

type.name: String
type.desc: The dialog will be hidden using the specified jQuery UI effect. See the list of effects for possible values.

type.name: Object
type.desc: If the value is an object, then effect, duration, and easing properties may be provided. The effect property must be the name of a jQuery UI effect. When using a jQuery UI effect that supports additional settings, you may include those settings in the object and they will be passed to the effect. If duration or easing is omitted, then the default values will be used.

option.name: maxHeight
option.desc: The maximum height to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

option.name: maxWidth
option.desc: The maximum width to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

option.name: minHeight
option.desc: The minimum height to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

option.name: minWidth
option.desc: The minimum width to which the dialog can be resized, in pixels.

option.name: modal
option.desc: If set to true, the dialog will have modal behavior; other items on the page will be disabled, i.e., cannot be interacted with. Modal dialogs create an overlay below the dialog but above other page elements.

option.name: position
option.example-value: { my: "left top", at: "left bottom", of: button }
option.desc: Specifies where the dialog should be displayed. The dialog will handle collisions such that as much of the dialog is visible as possible.

type.name: Object
type.desc: Identifies the position of the dialog when opened. The of option defaults to the window, but you can specify another element to position against. You can refer to the jQuery UI Position utility for more details about the various options.

type.name: String
type.desc: A string representing the position within the viewport. Possible values: "center", "left", "right", "top", "bottom".

type.name: Array
type.desc: An array containing an x, y coordinate pair in pixel offset from the top left corner of the viewport or the name of a possible string value.

option.name: resizable
option.desc: If set to true, the dialog will be resizable. Requires the jQuery UI Resizable widget to be included.

option.name: show
option.desc: If and how to animate the showing of the dialog.

type.name: Number
type.desc: The dialog will fade in while animating the height and width for the specified duration.

type.name: String
type.desc: The dialog will be shown using the specified jQuery UI effect. See the list of effects for possible values.

type.name: Object
type.desc: If the value is an object, then effect, duration, and easing properties may be provided. The effect property must be the name of a jQuery UI effect. When using a jQuery UI effect that supports additional settings, you may include those settings in the object and they will be passed to the effect. If duration or easing is omitted, then the default values will be used.

option.name: stack
option.desc: Specifies whether the dialog will stack on top of other dialogs. This will cause the dialog to move to the front of other dialogs when it gains focus.

option.name: title
option.desc: Specifies the title of the dialog. Any valid HTML may be set as the title. The title can also be specified by the title attribute on the dialog source element.

option.name: width
option.desc: The width of the dialog, in pixels.

option.name: zIndex
option.desc: The starting z-index for the dialog.

event.name: beforeClose
event.desc: Triggered when a dialog is about to close. If canceled, the dialog will not close.

event.desc: Triggered when the dialog is opened.
